definition: to lift a siege/to help sb out of trouble or embarrassment
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

sentences.english: When the crunch-card turns up, a bail-out card offers a way out.
sentences.chinese: 出现“紧缩”牌时，“保释”牌排忧解围。

sentences.english: I often think about Rosalyn and the way she turned to save me that day.
sentences.chinese: 我常常回想起罗莎琳和她那天给我解围的情形。

sentences.english: Zola takes, Cordoba heads clear at the far post.
sentences.chinese: 对方角球，佐拉主罚，科尔多巴在远端头取解围。

sentences.english: This is where flowcharts come to the rescue.
sentences.chinese: 这就需要流程图来解围了。

sentences.english: Ming secretly come to rong was caught by Cheng Lin men, and for the clearance.
sentences.chinese: 明偷偷来找蓉被程林手下抓住，蓉替其解围。

sentences.english: Liz: Thanks for helping me out.
They won three corners all of which Drogba headed away.
sentences.chinese: 他们获得了三个角球，但全数被德罗巴以头球解围。

sentences.english: The 60th minute, in Sun Xiang biography, but the Asian Touchy team breaks through.
sentences.chinese: 第60分钟，孙祥传中，但是亚塔奇队解围。

sentences.english: E.g. He always comes to my rescue whenever I get stuck.
sentences.chinese: 每次我遇到麻烦都是他帮我解围。

sentences.english: One particular left-footed touch saw him pluck the ball from the air inside his own penalty area.
sentences.chinese: 一次左脚的大脚解围将球踢出本方禁区。

definition: corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
to conspire/to plot (a rebellion, crime etc)/to machinate/to spur on/to urge action
